body_html: It's a little confusing, but SoftmaxCrossEntropyWithLogits has two outputs, 'loss' and 'backprop'. These are public properties of the returned SoftmaxCrossEntropyWithLogits instance (see https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/cc/class/tensorflow/ops/softmax-cross-entropy-with-logits), so can be accessed in your code via y.loss and y.backprop. Both of these should be added the outputs list I think.

These are public properties of the returned SoftmaxCrossEntropyWithLogits instance (see https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/cc/class/tensorflow/ops/softmax-cross-entropy-with-logits), so can be accessed in your code via y.loss and y.backprop. Both of these should be added the outputs list I think.
body: It's a little confusing, but SoftmaxCrossEntropyWithLogits has two outputs, 'loss' and 'backprop'. These are public properties of the returned SoftmaxCrossEntropyWithLogits instance (see https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/cc/class/tensorflow/ops/softmax-cross-entropy-with-logits), so can be accessed in your code via `y.loss` and `y.backprop`. Both of these should be added the `outputs` list I think.
